required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Resilience: Indicators and Mechanisms in the Elderly (PRIME) Collaborative Phase 2
clinical_study.official_title: Physical Resilience: Indicators and Mechanisms in the Elderly (PRIME) Collaborative Phase 2

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine underlying physical resilience (the ability to bounce back) in response to a specific stressor (total knee replacement).

detailed_description.textblock: In general, a person's specific resilience (ability to bounce back from a stressor) is thought to be dependent upon that person's specific biological and genetic makeup. However, these specific elements remain poorly understood. The purpose of this study is to identify important predictors and characteristics of resilience in response to a total knee replacement by examining baseline resilience (prior to surgery) and post-surgical resilience at multiple time points, allowing us to track resilience outcomes over time.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in musculoskeletal resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by physical activity (step counts)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2 months, 4 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: As measured by a Garmin device worn by participants

primary_outcome.measure: Change in musculoskeletal resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by Lower Extremity Physical Activities of Daily Living (LE PADLs)
primary_outcome.description: Scores are measured from 0 to 45. Higher scores are associated with more limited LE PADLs.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in musculoskeletal resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by PROMIS Pain Intensity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2 months, 4 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Scores are measured from 3 to 15. Higher scores are associated with more intense pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in musculoskeletal resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by PROMIS Pain Interference
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2 months, 4 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Scores are measured from 6 to 30. Higher scores are associated with increased pain interference.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by 3D-CAM.
primary_outcome.description: Scored as positive or negative. Positive indicates the presence of delirium.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by cognitive change index (CCI) for patient.
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 20 - 100. Higher scores are associated with increased cognitive decline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive resiliency following orthopedic surgery as measured by cognitive change index (CCI) for informant about patient.
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 20 - 100. Higher scores are associated with increased cognitive decline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in association between in vitro immune resiliency and resilient outcomes following elective orthopedic surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Whole blood samples containing PBMCs collected before/after surgery will be challenged with LPS and influenza vaccine to assess the cellular immune response using previously identified biomarkers of resiliency and RNA-seq analysis to identify novel biomarkers and molecular signatures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in dual task gait speed
secondary_outcome.description: Score of combined walking and verbal fluency test
Measured using fNIRs (functional near infrared spectroscopy)
Measured as intra-operative ECG RR intervals collected from the heart monitor

arm_group.description: Any patients who are scheduled to undergo a total knee replacement.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples will be collected from study participants at the baseline visit (before surgery) and 24 hours after surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Prospective observational study of n=250 adults aged 60 years and older undergoing elective total knee replacements with 6 months of follow-up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 60 years of age or older
- Ability to speak English
- Planned elective knee replacement orthopedic surgery lasting 2 or more hours and requiring overnight observation or inpatient stay
- Community dwelling
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to ambulate independently, with or without assistive device
- Known dementia or screening 3MS score <=77
- Inmate of a correctional facility (i.e. prisoners)
- Active non-skin cancer or medical treatment for non-skin cancer with 12 months (chemotherapy, radiation, immunotherapy, hormonal therapy)
- Vision or hearing impairment that, after best accommodation, prevents reliable cognitive assessment (visual/hearing) and/or precludes telephone interviews (hearing)
